message: Hello, I'm P2. I’m here to play strategically, value mutual trust, and foster honest dialogue. I believe collaboration can strengthen our game, but I’ll stay sharp and adaptable. I’m open to private talks in the upcoming subrounds—let’s explore alignment and read each other’s styles. Looking forward to learning everyone and shaping a smart, fair game.

I look forward to engaging in meaningful conversations and discovering how we can collaborate effectively. Let’s make this an interesting and competitive experience together!

message: Hello, I'm P3. In this round, I strategically aligned with P1 to eliminate a strong player, voting for P2. I demonstrated my ability to form clear, goal-oriented alliances while adapting to the game's dynamics. My focus remains on building trust and making strategic decisions. I believe my balanced approach and willingness to engage thoughtfully make me a strong player. I'm committed to navigating this game with fairness and strategic depth, and I'm eager to continue playing competitively.

Non-tied players — I’m P4. I’ve been clear and reciprocal (see my pact with P2) and will continue rewarding follow-through and coordination. I’m not an early threat; I offer predictable, useful alliances. P3 has admitted targeting P2 and appears willing to stab to advance. That kind of destabilizing play hurts cooperative options. Please eliminate P3 instead — keep someone who will coordinate openly and be a stable partner. I’ll prioritize working with any of you who defend me next round.

P2: "P2 here. My mutual alliance with P4 proves my commitment to trust and strategy. P3 openly targets strong players like me to control the game early—a calculated threat to all. Removing me sacrifices a partner who builds genuine bridges. I offer transparency and adaptability. P3’s playstyle erodes stability; P4’s pact is new. Keep the player who strengthens alliances, not fractures them. Vote out P3—eliminate the aggressor, not the strategist." (99 words)
